conclusion: Analyze the motion of the particle based on the v-t graph symmetry and passing through a position three times.
The graph is symmetric about the dashed line.
The particle's motion is mirrored around the dashed line, implying symmetric velocity changes.
The v-t graph shows the velocity of the particle as a function of time.
The area under the v-t graph represents the displacement of the particle.
For the particle to pass through a position three times, it must change direction at least twice.
The particle must have at least two points where its velocity is zero.
Scenario 1: The particle starts at a position, moves away, returns, moves away again, and returns a third time.
Scenario 2: The particle follows a different path or speed profile but still returns to the position three times.
Graph symmetry implies the particle's motion before and after the dashed line are mirror images.
Symmetry suggests consistent velocity changes with returning to the same position multiple times.
Conclusion: The particle moves away, returns, moves away again, and returns a third time with two turning points.
